preview.0: Sensors on NASA's Perseverance will help prepare for future human exploration by taking weather measurements and studying dust particles.
preview.1: The agency's new Mars rover is put through a series of tests in vacuum chambers, acoustic chambers and more to get ready for the Red Planet.
preview.2: The board will assist with analysis of current plans and goals for one of the most difficult missions humanity has ever undertaken.
preview.3: An electronics issue is suspected to be preventing the sensors from sharing their data about Mars weather with the spacecraft.
preview.4: From rockets to rovers, JPL's Spacecraft Assembly Facility has been at the center of robotic spaceflight. Here's a closer look at what makes it so special.
preview.5: With the Mars 2020 mission ramping up, the documentary — the first of four about past JPL missions to the Red Planet to be shown at Caltech — tells a gripping backstory.
preview.6: In time-lapse video, taken at JPL, captures the first time NASA's Mars 2020 rover carries its full weight on its legs and wheels.
preview.7: During this next phase, the program will mature critical technologies and make critical design decisions as well as assess industry partnerships.
preview.8: The agency's first step in returning rocks from Mars just arrived at Kennedy Space Center. The Mars 2020 team now begins readying for a launch to the Red Planet this July.
preview.9: This new portrait of the Red Planet's neighbors was taken during a time when there's more dust in the air on Mars.
preview.10: Apollo 12 and the upcoming Mars 2020 mission may be separated by half a century, but they share several goals unique in the annals of space exploration.
preview.11: The leadership council for Mars 2020 science added two new members who represent the interests of scientists destined to handle and study the first samples from Red Planet.
preview.12: Listen to the marsquakes and other, less-expected sounds that the Mars lander has been detecting.
preview.13: NASA released an independent review report Tuesday indicating the agency is well positioned for its Mars Sample Return campaign to bring pristine samples from Mars to Earth for scientific study.
preview.14: The twin spacecraft, the first of their kind to fly into deep space, earn a Laureate from Aviation Week & Space Technology.
